"Crime and Punishment"  

Just let her see you can’t get enough of her—that’s all you need. It’s super chill; you can read, sit, lie around, or write. You might even go for a kiss if you play it cool. 😏  

‘But why do I even want to be with her?’  

‘Ugh, I can’t explain it! You two are meant for each other! I’ve thought about this a lot! … You’ll figure it out eventually! So, does it really matter if it’s now or later? There’s a cozy vibe here, man—seriously! Plus, there’s something special about this place—it's like the end of the world, a safe spot, the center of everything. It’s all the good stuff: pancakes, tasty fish pies, evening tea, soft sighs, warm blankets, and hot stoves to nap on—so comfy it feels like you’re dead, but you’re still alive. You get the best of both worlds! Alright, I’m rambling; it’s late! Listen, sometimes I wake up at night, so I’ll go check on him. But really, it’s fine. Don’t stress, but if you want, you can peek in too. Just let me know if you see anything weird—like fever or delirium—wake me up right away. But there shouldn’t be any…."

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The conversation emphasizes the comfort and deep connection between two individuals, suggesting they are meant for each other despite initial reluctance.
